solution_line_template: Half of the trip lasts for {total_trip_duration} * {half_factor} = <<{total_trip_duration}*{half_factor}={half_trip_duration}>>{half_trip_duration} hours.
During the first half, Martin did {half_trip_duration} * {speed_first_half} = <<{half_trip_duration}*{speed_first_half}={distance_first_half}>>{distance_first_half} kilometers.
And during the second half {half_trip_duration} * {speed_second_half} = <<{half_trip_duration}*{speed_second_half}={distance_second_half}>>{distance_second_half} kilometers.
In total Martin traveled {distance_first_half} + {distance_second_half} = <<{distance_first_half}+{distance_second_half}={total_distance}>>{total_distance} kilometers during his business trip.
